channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report I-2023060169
item.description:
Report I-2023060169

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: Jamaica
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DHL EXPRESS (USA), INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 06/15/2023 this shipment had hidden dangerous goods that were discovered during the shipment inspection process at the at the DHL JFK service center, Bldg 263, JFK Int'I Airport, Jamaica, NY 11430 Transportation by road has been confirmed.

item.title: Report X-2023061678
item.description:
Report X-2023061678

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-25
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Q.A. was walking past the overhead conveyor belt and noticed a jammed and leaking hazmat. DescribePack: the caps on inner bottles failed while in transit. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the hazmat was taken off the belt carefully and placed in a bucket to be transported to the hazmat cage to be evaluated and repacked into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report E-2023070073
item.description:
Report E-2023070073

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: CASTLETON ON HUDSON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a pallet that had boxes on it that had been crushed by top freight loaded onto it consequently crushing inner containers contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as were the crushed containers.

item.title: Report X-2023061620
item.description:
Report X-2023061620

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When walking the load dock, I was informed that a package had a leakage. The package in fact had liquid pouring out of it at a rapid speed. I immediately obtained a hazemat bag and bucket to contain the liquid. DescribePack: The cap was off the gallon hypochlorite solution DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bottle was put right side up

item.title: Report X-2023061612
item.description:
Report X-2023061612

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: LONG ISLAND CITY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: SEQUENCE OF EVENTS IS UNKNOWN. DescribePack: THIS PKG CONTAINS FOUR PLASTIC CONTAINERS OF DISINFECTANT SOLUTION. UNFORTUNATELY, THIS PACKAGE BECAME DAMAGED WHILE IN TRANSIT. ONE OF THE CONTAINERS HAS NO SEAL AND A LOOSE CAP. AS A RESULT, SOME OF THE LIQUID HAS LEAKED OUT OF THE CONTAINER. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PKG WAS PLACED IN A LARGE PLASTIC BAG AND PLACED IN OUR DAMAGED HAZMAT AREA.

item.title: Report X-2023061566
item.description:
Report X-2023061566

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was on the rollers in unload and was pushed along with the ICs. It was accidentally pushed to the floor. DescribePack: The package had one gallon rupture at the cap when it hit the floor. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The belts in the building were stopped, and the hazmat was placed in a red tote by QA. No package handlers touched the damage hazmat, and there was no leakage from the hazmat to other packages.

item.title: Report X-2023061550
item.description:
Report X-2023061550

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Q.A. found a leaking hazmat in the unload area placed on the rollers. After finding the damaged package it was placed in a tote and transported to the hazmat cage to be evaluated and repacked into a salvage drum. DescribePack: the corrosive liquid ate through the box causing a 3x6 hole in the right-hand side of the box. two of the four bottles had loose caps causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the hazmat was taken from the unload and placed in a tote to contain any more toxins and liquid from escaping into a un-contained area until it was taken to the hazmat cage to be safely repacking into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2023061253
item.description:
Report X-2023061253

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: NEWBURGH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Qa was called to the trailer to check on package upon further inspection qa saw that the contents inside were leaking due to the loose cap and mishandling of the package DescribePack: one of the caps were loose and ill fitting DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was removed from the trailer instantly and processed

item.title: Report X-2023061251
item.description:
Report X-2023061251

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-19
  • City: RENSSELAER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: No one witnessed the cause of the incident, they only realized it was leaking as it came down the belt. Based on the appearance of the jerrican, the dents and dirt covering the bottom, I surmise that the crack formed from the wear and tear packages typically receive in transit. DescribePack: The crack is in the bottom corner of the jug, barely an inch long but the location made the contents leak quickly. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Item was immediately placed in a hazmat drum, spillage was covered with absorbent pads to clean up.
